name: Alek
bio: I am a full-stack developer with 1 year of experience in web environments. I enjoy and feel highly motivated participating in solutions that involve great utility and excellent presentation, such as IoT applications and essentially web design, using tools like React, Next.js, or Python. My greatest inspiration is contributing to a goal with perspective, and with that, learning and formalizing my professional outlook to a concrete point. Willing to work hard and learn in the process, I am ready to accomplish great things.

projects.name: Self-sufficient and automated lamp
projects.description: This project arose as a response to a need to renew garden lighting after some structural changes. With an interest in energy efficiency and environmental respect, I sought to integrate a solar lighting system. In addition, I took the opportunity to delve into the world of IoT, automating the system through sensors and connected devices, which allowed me to explore new technologies and apply my knowledge in designing and programming intelligent architectures.

projects.name: Ordenna
projects.description: Ordenna is an automatic, accessible, and low-cost inventory management system, developed as a Final Degree Project. It uses an ESP32-CAM that takes periodic overhead photos of shelves where items are marked with colored stickers (ðŸ”´ðŸŸ¡ðŸ”µ). A FastAPI (Python) application with OpenCV analyzes each image to detect, count, and classify products, storing results in a structured database. The information is displayed on a web interface with charts and user access for clients. It is designed to adapt from company warehouses to a home pantry.

projects.name: Drag'n'Drop Notes
projects.description: Test project to learn how to use drag and drop with the React dnd-kit library. Expected features include note saving, editing, deletion, etc. Currently in development.

descriptions: Development of internal management web applications and visualization/control of files with ASP.NET AJAX.
Management and control of database connections with SQL Server.
Development of real-time andon call system with ASP.NET AJAX and Ignition.
Digitization of traditional work report processes.
Data visualization template with logic and design for mechanical presses.

participaciones.name: WordCamp 2025 LogroÃ±o
participaciones.description: I attended this event with the enthusiasm and goal of meeting many new people who opened my eyes to web programming content, technology, design, and marketing. I learned a lot throughout the conferences and conversations with program attendees and the developer community, having a great time, obviously.

participaciones.name: Agents of Change
participaciones.description: I completed the parallel Change Agents course, an Government of Spain and European Union proposal for the digital transition of SMEs with a focus on planning digital brand development projects. Here I essentially learned how to properly manage an analysis plan of company strengths and weaknesses and actions that must be taken to meet customer needs and be competitive.

participaciones.name: Food Bank
participaciones.description: It was not a learning experience directly related to work, but I felt an indirect contribution to a goal I consider noble. Moreover, it helped me open my mind and take a step forward to show proposals and reason.

participaciones.name: Hacka Retods
participaciones.description: We ended as finalists with a different proposal: HydroLoop, a home water recycling solution. I took part on a team in a collaboration activity aimed at prioritizing the resolution of a socioeconomic problem with the help of technology and innovation. The fundamental aspect of this experience was having to devise a plan compatible with one or more of the 17 sustainable development goals.
